response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "The purpose of this Act is to provide communities the opportunity to protest the renewal of certain liquor licenses. [CHUNK_4] This bill amends section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to apply to both the issuance of new liquor licenses, and the renewal of existing liquor licenses. [CHUNK_5] It provides that the Liquor Commission or other licensing agency of each county shall deny the renewal of certain current liquor licenses upon receipt of sufficient protests. [CHUNK_8]",
  "appropriations": "This bill does not contain any appropriations. [CHUNK_7] No funding amounts are specified for staffing, training, or any other operational costs associated with its implementation. [CHUNK_8] The measure does not allocate any financial resources. [CHUNK_9]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The provided legislative text does not contain any financial projections, assumptions, or a methodology for estimating costs. [CHUNK_9] The potential increase in workload for county liquor commissions is not quantified. [CHUNK_8] No data sources or comparable programs are referenced to determine the fiscal impact. [CHUNK_4]",
  "agency_impact": "This measure will affect the Liquor Commission or other licensing agency of each county. [CHUNK_8] These agencies will be required to handle protests for the renewal of existing liquor licenses, which is an expansion of the current law that applies only to new licenses. [CHUNK_2] This change may increase the administrative workload for processing protests and conducting related proceedings. [CHUNK_4]",
  "economic_impact": "The legislature finds that patrons leaving a liquor establishment can adversely affect neighboring residents and users of nearby public facilities. [CHUNK_1] The Act is intended to promote an environment in which alcohol imbibing patrons do not interfere with minors or other residents. [CHUNK_2] The bill does not specify any direct economic impacts, such as cost savings or revenue generation for the state or counties. [CHUNK_9]",
  "policy_impact": "This Act amends section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, by expanding its applicability. [CHUNK_5] The bill alters the existing statute which currently applies only to the issuance of new liquor licenses, but not the renewal of current licenses. [CHUNK_2] This removes what the legislature finds is a safe harbor for existing establishments seeking a renewal of their liquor license. [CHUNK_3]",
  "revenue_sources": "The bill does not identify any revenue sources to support its implementation. [CHUNK_7] No general funds, special funds, or fees are mentioned as sources of funding for the potential increase in administrative duties for county agencies. [CHUNK_8] The measure does not establish any new revenue streams. [CHUNK_9]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The provided text does not contain specific information to determine the six-year fiscal implications of this measure. [CHUNK_9] The bill does not appropriate funds or authorize any positions. [CHUNK_7] Any fiscal impact would affect the respective county liquor commissions, not the state. [CHUNK_8] The costs would be contingent on the number of liquor license renewal applications that are protested by the community, which is an unknown variable. [CHUNK_4] An increase in protests would likely lead to increased administrative costs for processing applications and holding hearings. [CHUNK_3] As the volume of future protests cannot be predicted, the potential costs are indeterminate. [CHUNK_2] The bill does not provide projections for costs, staffing changes, or recurring expenses over a multi-year period. [CHUNK_8] Statutory material to be repealed is bracketed and stricken. [CHUNK_7] New statutory material is underscored. [CHUNK_7] This Act shall take effect upon its approval. [CHUNK_7]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The bill is not anticipated to have a direct impact on state or county operating revenues. [CHUNK_8] No new fees, fines, or other revenue-generating mechanisms are established in the Act. [CHUNK_9] A potential indirect impact could be a loss of license renewal fee revenue for counties if a significant number of licenses are successfully protested and denied, but this is not specified in the text. [CHUNK_4]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "This bill does not require any capital expenditures. [CHUNK_9] There is no mention of costs for facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure. [CHUNK_8] The measure is a statutory amendment and does not include any provisions related to capital improvement projects. [CHUNK_5]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The fiscal implications after six years are indeterminate but ongoing. [CHUNK_9] As the bill amends a statute without a sunset provision, the change allowing protests of license renewals will be permanent. [CHUNK_5] Consequently, any associated administrative costs for county liquor commissions would be recurring and depend on the level of community protest activity in any given year. [CHUNK_4]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "No previous fiscal note was provided for comparison. [CHUNK_9]"
}

  "overview": "The purpose of this Act is to provide communities the opportunity to protest the renewal of certain liquor licenses. [CHUNK_4] This bill amends section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to apply to both the issuance of new liquor licenses, and the renewal of existing liquor licenses.   "capital_expenditure_impact": "This bill does not require any capital expenditures. [CHUNK_9] There is no mention of costs for facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure. [CHUNK_8] The measure is a statutory amendment and does not include any provisions related to capital improvement projects. [CHUNK_5]",

chunk_details.chunk_text: HB2 HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES H.B. NO. 2 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 STATE OF HAWAII A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO LIQUOR LICENSES . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. The legislature finds that patrons leaving a liquor establishment can adversely affect neighboring residents

patrons leaving a liquor establishment can adversely affect neighboring residents and users of nearby public facilities. The legislature enacted section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which allows for the denial or restriction of liquor licenses for certain establishments near schools or parks, to promote an environment in which alcohol imbibing patrons

parks, to promote an environment in which alcohol imbibing patrons do not interfere with minors or other residents. The legislature further finds that section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, currently applies only to the issuance of new liquor licenses, but not the renewal of current licenses, thus creating a safe harbor

the renewal of current licenses, thus creating a safe harbor for existing establishments seeking a renewal of their liquor license. Although registered voters within five hundred feet of a liquor establishment may not be inclined to protest the initial issuance of a liquor license, they may wish to do so

of a liquor license, they may wish to do so when the license becomes subject to renewal and they have learned more about the establishment. Accordingly, the purpose of this Act is to provide communities the opportunity to protest the renewal of certain liquor licenses. SECTION 2 . Section 281-39.5,

renewal of certain liquor licenses. SECTION 2 . Section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by amending subsection (b) to read as follows: "(b) This section shall apply [ only ] to both the issuance of new liquor licenses , and the renewal of existing liquor licenses, for on-site sale

and the renewal of existing liquor licenses, for on-site sale and consumption by the drink [ and not to any renewal of such licenses ]." SECTION 3. This Act does not affect rights and duties that matured, penalties that were incurred, and proceedings that were begun before its effective date.

incurred, and proceedings that were begun before its effective date. SECTION 4. Statutory material to be repealed is bracketed and stricken. New statutory material is underscored. SECTION 5. This Act shall take effect upon its approval. INTRODUCED BY: _____________________________ Report Title: Liquor Licenses; Renewal; Protest; Denial Description: Provides that the

Title: Liquor Licenses; Renewal; Protest; Denial Description: Provides that the Liquor Commission or other licensing agency of each county shall deny the renewal of certain current liquor licenses upon receipt of sufficient protests. this page is for informational purposes only and is not legislation or evidence of legislative intent.

patrons leaving a liquor establishment can adversely affect neighboring residents and users of nearby public facilities. the renewal of current licenses, thus creating a safe harbor for existing establishments seeking a renewal of their liquor license.
